</p>
<p style="font-size:.9em;">Taimi's original appearance.</p><a href="/wiki/File:Taimi_LWS3.jpg" class="image"><img alt="Taimi LWS3.jpg" src="/images/thumb/f/f4/Taimi_LWS3.jpg/133px-Taimi_LWS3.jpg" decoding="async" width="133" height="200" srcset="/images/thumb/f/f4/Taimi_LWS3.jpg/200px-Taimi_LWS3.jpg 1.5x, /images/thumb/f/f4/Taimi_LWS3.jpg/267px-Taimi_LWS3.jpg 2x" data-file-width="624" data-file-height="934"></a>
<p style="font-size:.9em;">Taimi's appearance during <a href="/wiki/Living_World_Season_3" title="Living World Season 3">Living World Season 3</a>.</p><a href="/wiki/File:Taimi_(EoD).jpg" class="image"><img alt="Taimi (EoD).jpg" src="/images/thumb/7/71/Taimi_%28EoD%29.jpg/141px-Taimi_%28EoD%29.jpg" decoding="async" width="141" height="200" srcset="/images/thumb/7/71/Taimi_%28EoD%29.jpg/212px-Taimi_%28EoD%29.jpg 1.5x, /images/thumb/7/71/Taimi_%28EoD%29.jpg/283px-Taimi_%28EoD%29.jpg 2x" data-file-width="402" data-file-height="568"></a>
<p style="font-size:.9em;">Taimi's appearance at the end of <a href="/wiki/End_of_Dragons" class="mw-redirect" title="End of Dragons">End of Dragons</a>.</p>

</div> 
<blockquote style="padding: 0em 2em 0em 1em; margin: 1em 0em 1em 4em; border-left: 1px solid silver;"><div style="position: absolute; margin-top: -0.2em; margin-left: -0.8em; font: bold 5em Times New Roman, Times, Georgie, serif; color: silver;"></div><div style="line-height: 1.53846em;">
<p>He chose to help a lot of people, despite the cost. His life meant something. His death meant something. That's powerful, isn't it? I just... I hope I get a chance like that.
</p>
</div><p class="noexcerpt" style="padding-left: 1.6em; font-size: 0.9em; font-style:italic;"> <a href="/wiki/Storm_Tracking" title="Storm Tracking">Taimi</a></p>
</blockquote>
<p><a class="mw-selflink selflink">Taimi</a> (born in 1313 <small><a href="/wiki/Mouvelian_calendar" title="Mouvelian calendar">AE</a></small>, in late spring or summer)<sup id="cite_ref-BtS_1-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BtS-1">[1]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-2">[2]</a></sup> is an <a href="/wiki/Asura" title="Asura">asura</a> studying at the <a href="/wiki/College_of_Synergetics" title="College of Synergetics">College of Synergetics</a>. An apprentice of the renowned <a href="/wiki/Golemancer" title="Golemancer">golemancer</a> <a href="/wiki/Zojja" title="Zojja">Zojja</a>, Taimi requires the assistance of a <a href="/wiki/Golem" title="Golem">golem</a> named <a href="/wiki/Scruffy" title="Scruffy">Scruffy</a> to get around, owing to a degenerative bone disease that prevents her from walking long distances and may spread to other parts of her body as she gets older.<sup id="cite_ref-BtS_1-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BtS-1">[1]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-TaimiDisease_3-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TaimiDisease-3">[3]</a></sup> Although there is no known cure, this <a href="/wiki/Progeny" title="Progeny">progeny</a> is quick to refuse any offer of pity.
</p>

<h2><span class="mw-headline" id="Biography">Biography</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=1" title="Edit section: Biography">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h2>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Early_years">Early years</span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=2" title="Edit section: Early years">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>Taimi was born in late spring or summer of 1313 <small><a href="/wiki/Mouvelian_calendar" title="Mouvelian calendar">AE</a></small>. An orphan since birth, she became a ward of the Progeny Protective Services, a social agency division in <a href="/wiki/Rata_Sum" title="Rata Sum">Rata Sum</a>.<sup id="cite_ref-4" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-4">[4]</a></sup> She showed a brilliant mind from an early age but was physically hampered by a degenerative bone disease that affected her movement.<sup id="cite_ref-BtS_1-2" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-BtS-1">[1]</a></sup><sup id="cite_ref-TaimiDisease_3-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-TaimiDisease-3">[3]</a></sup> She enrolled in the <a href="/wiki/College_of_Synergetics" title="College of Synergetics">College of Synergetics</a> and eventually became the <a href="/wiki/Golemancer" title="Golemancer">golemancer</a> <a href="/wiki/Zojja" title="Zojja">Zojja</a>'s apprentice. During her college days she befriended the brothers <a href="/wiki/Blish" title="Blish">Blish</a> and <a href="/wiki/Gorrik" title="Gorrik">Gorrik</a>.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Living_World_Season_1"><a href="/wiki/Living_World_Season_1" title="Living World Season 1">Living World Season 1</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=3" title="Edit section: Living World Season 1">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Battle_for_Lion%27s_Arch" title="Battle for Lion's Arch">Battle for Lion's Arch</a></dt></dl>
<p>Taimi appeared at the <a href="/wiki/Marionette%27s_Landing" title="Marionette's Landing">Marionette's Landing</a> in <a href="/wiki/Lornar%27s_Pass" title="Lornar's Pass">Lornar's Pass</a> in 1327 <small><a href="/wiki/Mouvelian_calendar" title="Mouvelian calendar">AE</a></small>, claiming to be on an important field experiment for her <a href="/wiki/Asuran_college" title="Asuran college">college</a>. After the defeat of the <a href="/wiki/Twisted_Marionette" title="Twisted Marionette">Twisted Marionette</a>, <a href="/wiki/Logan_Thackeray" title="Logan Thackeray">Logan Thackeray</a> took her to <a href="/wiki/Lion%27s_Arch" title="Lion's Arch">Lion's Arch</a>, where she claimed <a href="/wiki/Braham" title="Braham">Braham</a> was her guardian (although the <a href="/wiki/Norn" title="Norn">norn</a> denied ever meeting her). She used Logan and Braham to get to know the <a href="/wiki/Pact_Commander" title="Pact Commander">Pact Commander</a>, <a href="/wiki/Kasmeer_Meade" title="Kasmeer Meade">Kasmeer Meade</a>, <a href="/wiki/Marjory_Delaqua" title="Marjory Delaqua">Marjory Delaqua</a>, and <a href="/wiki/Rox" title="Rox">Rox</a>. She showed an intense interest in <a href="/wiki/Scarlet_Briar" title="Scarlet Briar">Scarlet Briar</a> who had been behind the attacks of the Twisted Marionette and various nefarious <a href="/wiki/Scarlet%27s_Alliance" title="Scarlet's Alliance">alliances</a>, and expressed a desire to meet with her.
</p><p>While Taimi and Braham were still in Lion's Arch, Scarlet broke <a href="/wiki/Captain_Mai_Trin" title="Captain Mai Trin">Mai Trin</a> out of <a href="/wiki/Fort_Marriner" title="Fort Marriner">Fort Marriner</a>. Taimi, followed by Braham, pursued them into the <a href="/wiki/Edge_of_the_Mists" title="Edge of the Mists">Edge of the Mists</a> where her <a href="/wiki/Golem" title="Golem">golem</a> <a href="/wiki/Scruffy" title="Scruffy">Scruffy</a> was damaged. The Commander showed up later and helped Taimi repair her golem. Meanwhile, she and Braham spent time together and got to know each other better.
</p><p>Since the attack on Lion's Arch, Taimi hung around in the safety of <a href="/wiki/Vigil_Keep" title="Vigil Keep">Vigil Keep</a>, hoping to find an eyewitness account of Scarlet in Lion's Arch. She ultimately realized the terror Scarlet had wrought when witnessing the loss of life during the <a href="/wiki/Escape_from_Lion%27s_Arch_(story)" title="Escape from Lion's Arch (story)">evacuation of Lion's Arch</a> although she still acknowledged Scarlet as a genius even if a troubled one. She stayed safely out of Lion's Arch while the Pact Commander's party killed Scarlet aboard <i><a href="/wiki/The_Breachmaker" title="The Breachmaker">the Breachmaker</a></i>; however, Scarlet still succeeded even in death when her falling flagship managed to redirect the <a href="/wiki/Ley_line" title="Ley line">ley lines</a> underneath the city to the <a href="/wiki/Heart_of_Maguuma" title="Heart of Maguuma">Heart of Maguuma</a> where an <a href="/wiki/Elder_Dragon" title="Elder Dragon">Elder Dragon</a>'s roar was heard. Taimi regrouped with the others in <a href="/wiki/The_Dead_End" title="The Dead End">The Dead End</a>, joining their celebration and officially becoming a member of the group while warning the others of what that roar they heard was.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Living_World_Season_2"><a href="/wiki/Living_World_Season_2" title="Living World Season 2">Living World Season 2</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=4" title="Edit section: Living World Season 2">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Gates_of_Maguuma" title="Gates of Maguuma">Gates of Maguuma</a></dt></dl>
<p>After the Elder Dragon <a href="/wiki/Mordremoth" title="Mordremoth">Mordremoth</a>'s awakening in 1326 <small>AE</small>, Taimi and the rest of the team, including the Pact Commander, were called to <a href="/wiki/Dry_Top" title="Dry Top">Dry Top</a> by the <a href="/wiki/Seraph" title="Seraph">Seraph</a> in order to investigate some strange vines growing in the region, as well as the crash of the <a href="/wiki/Zephyr_Sanctum" title="Zephyr Sanctum">Zephyr Sanctum</a>. They chased down <a href="/wiki/Aerin" title="Aerin">Aerin</a>, the maddened sylvari saboteur of that crash who perished in the ensuing battle with the team, and later discovered a strange room belonging to Scarlet prior to her visions of the <a href="/wiki/Eternal_Alchemy" title="Eternal Alchemy">Eternal Alchemy</a>. Realizing that Aerin had showed similar symptoms of madness as Scarlet, they decided to investigate a potential connection between the two.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Entanglement" title="Entanglement">Entanglement</a></dt></dl>
<p>Being the foremost expert on Scarlet, Taimi took to the artifacts and quickly became absorbed in researching them. She later discovered a secret path to a <a href="/wiki/Ley_Line_Hub" title="Ley Line Hub">ley line hub</a> which she assisted the Commander and their group in retaking for themselves. She then continued her research into ley line energy which helped expose the vulnerability of the waypoint system as well as impending <a href="/wiki/Mordrem" title="Mordrem">Mordrem</a> attacks on both <a href="/wiki/Fort_Concordia" class="mw-redirect" title="Fort Concordia">Fort Concordia</a> and <a href="/wiki/Fort_Salma" title="Fort Salma">Fort Salma</a>. While the Commander was assisted by the rest of the team in resolving those issues, Taimi discovered <a href="/wiki/Omadd" class="mw-redirect" title="Omadd">Omadd</a>'s <a href="/wiki/Omadd%27s_Machine" title="Omadd's Machine">machine</a>, the device Scarlet had used to view the Eternal Alchemy, and sought to use it on herself. After a scuffle with the Commander, however, it was the Commander that was subjected to the mind opening experience instead of Taimi.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/The_Dragon%27s_Reach:_Part_1" title="The Dragon's Reach: Part 1">The Dragon's Reach: Part 1</a></dt></dl>
<p>As the Commander set off to recruit the world leaders to <a href="/wiki/The_World_Summit" title="The World Summit">the World Summit</a> to discuss the threat Mordremoth was now posing, Taimi finished work on her waypoint calibration device despite the snide remarks and overbearing presence of Councillor <a href="/wiki/Phlunt" title="Phlunt">Phlunt</a>.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/The_Dragon%27s_Reach:_Part_2" title="The Dragon's Reach: Part 2">The Dragon's Reach: Part 2</a></dt></dl>
<p>After finishing the device with the visiting Commander's help, Taimi started the process of recalibrating the waypoint system, which finished with Mordemoth's minions attempting to destroy the device. With the Commander's help, the minions were pushed back, but Phlunt demanded that Taimi hand over her research and knowledge to hold in trust until she graduated from the college. Taimi did not want to give up what she had worked so hard to achieve, so she fled deeper into Dry Top before being cornered by the <a href="/wiki/Inquest" title="Inquest">Inquest</a>. The Commander and Braham fought the Inquest off, and ultimately convinced Taimi to give up the device for the greater good.
</p><p>Taimi was later invited to the World Summit in <a href="/wiki/The_Grove" title="The Grove">the Grove</a>. Due to her golem and her refusal to give it up, she stayed on the lower level and assisted with evacuating and protecting the world leaders when the <a href="/wiki/Shadow_of_the_Dragon" title="Shadow of the Dragon">Shadow of the Dragon</a> led a Mordrem assault on the summit. The <a href="/wiki/Pale_Tree" title="Pale Tree">Pale Tree</a> was left weakened after the <a href="/wiki/Dragon_champion" title="Dragon champion">dragon champion</a> had been driven off, but the attack convinced the five races that they needed to pool their resources together and mobilize the <a href="/wiki/Pact" title="Pact">Pact</a> to take the fight to Mordremoth before the Elder Dragon would be too powerful to stop.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Echoes_of_the_Past" title="Echoes of the Past">Echoes of the Past</a></dt></dl>
<p>Taimi moved to the Pact staging ground of <a href="/wiki/Camp_Resolve" title="Camp Resolve">Camp Resolve</a> in <a href="/wiki/The_Silverwastes" title="The Silverwastes">the Silverwastes</a> where she began studying under the <a href="/wiki/Charr" title="Charr">charr</a> engineer <a href="/wiki/Brun_Ingotspitter" title="Brun Ingotspitter">Brun Ingotspitter</a>.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Point_of_No_Return" title="Point of No Return">Point of No Return</a></dt></dl>
<p>Later, she was mentioned to have returned to her studies at the College of Synergetics during the downfall of the Shadow of the Dragon. However, as word got out of the Pact fleet's destruction in Mordremoth's surprise assault, Taimi returned to Camp Resolve.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Heart_of_Thorns"><a href="/wiki/Guild_Wars_2:_Heart_of_Thorns" title="Guild Wars 2: Heart of Thorns">Heart of Thorns</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=5" title="Edit section: Heart of Thorns">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<dl><dt>Act I</dt></dl>
<p>When the Pact fleet was brought down by Mordremoth in 1328 <small>AE</small>, Taimi joined <a href="/wiki/Canach" title="Canach">Canach</a> and a few other Pact soldiers in securing the passage into <a href="/wiki/Verdant_Brink" title="Verdant Brink">Verdant Brink</a> just beyond <a href="/wiki/Amber_Sandfall" title="Amber Sandfall">Amber Sandfall</a>. With the Pact Commander's arrival, the two had joined alongside Braham Eirsson, Marjory Delaqua, Kasmeer Meade, and Rox, and Taimi learned what had been happening to the party in her absence.
</p><p>In Verdant Brink, the party encountered <a href="/wiki/Laranthir_of_the_Wild" title="Laranthir of the Wild">Laranthir of the Wild</a> and other Pact survivors and scouted to find <a href="/wiki/Destiny%27s_Edge" title="Destiny's Edge">Destiny's Edge</a> members who had gone missing after the crash. They discovered that Mordremoth had managed to turn many sylvari to its side, forming the <a href="/wiki/Mordrem_Guard" title="Mordrem Guard">Mordrem Guard</a>, while sylvari who were still loyal to the Pact were struggling with the voice of Mordremoth which was trying to overwhelm their minds.
</p><p>While searching the jungle for any leads on the whereabouts of Destiny's Edge and Marshal <a href="/wiki/Trahearne" title="Trahearne">Trahearne</a>, the group encountered the <a href="/wiki/Itzel" title="Itzel">Itzel</a> <a href="/wiki/Hylek" title="Hylek">hylek</a> and agreed to help their <a href="/wiki/Jaka_Itzel" title="Jaka Itzel">village</a> against the Mordrem assault. Taimi advocated for joining the <a href="/wiki/Nuhoch" title="Nuhoch">Nuhoch</a> <a href="/wiki/Tizlak" title="Tizlak">Tizlak</a> in taking the fight to the enemy. Once the Mordrem had been defeated, the Itzel and Nuhoch assisted the party in finding a trail that led to a nearby Mordrem prison camp which contained various Pact soldiers as well as <a href="/wiki/Nightmare_Court" title="Nightmare Court">Nightmare Courtiers</a>.
</p><p>After saving the prisoners, the team found a cell which contained both Braham's mother <a href="/wiki/Eir_Stegalkin" title="Eir Stegalkin">Eir Stegalkin</a> and Grand Duchess <a href="/wiki/Faolain" title="Faolain">Faolain</a> of the Nightmare Court. Despite misgivings about Faolain's appearance, they freed both women only for the pair to be ambushed by <a href="/wiki/Mordrem_Vinetooth" title="Mordrem Vinetooth">Mordrem vinetooths</a>, special hunters created by Mordremoth, one of which took Faolain while the other confronted and killed Eir. The party defeated the vinetooth and left Braham to mourn his mother with Rox as his company, heading deeper into the jungle.
</p>
<dl><dt>Act II</dt></dl>
<p>After entering <a href="/wiki/Auric_Basin" title="Auric Basin">Auric Basin</a>, the party encountered the mysterious <a href="/wiki/Ruka_the_Wanderer" title="Ruka the Wanderer">Ruka the Wanderer</a> who was also opposed to Mordremoth along with his fellow <a href="/wiki/Exalted" title="Exalted">Exalted</a>. They found Destiny's Edge member <a href="/wiki/Caithe" title="Caithe">Caithe</a>, who was in possession of <a href="/wiki/Glint%27s_Egg" title="Glint's Egg">Glint's Egg</a>, nearby only to witness her being ambushed by Faolain who had been turned into a creature resembling the vinetooths from earlier. The Commander took the egg and successfully delivered it to safety in <a href="/wiki/Tarir,_the_Forgotten_City" title="Tarir, the Forgotten City">Tarir, the Forgotten City</a> while eluding Faolain.
</p><p>Following Caithe's hasty departure, Taimi became fascinated with the Exalted's <a href="/wiki/Magic" title="Magic">magic</a>. After the Commander was separated from the rest by Faolain, the prodigy constructed <a href="/wiki/Taimi_Hologram" title="Taimi Hologram">holodiscs</a> to leave as a trail, which helped the Commander catch up with the party. Upon Scruffy reading strange energy, Taimi left the group in search for it and, with the Commander's aid, reactivated a device that mapped out sources of ley energy across the <a href="/wiki/Heart_of_Maguuma" title="Heart of Maguuma">Heart of Maguuma</a>. This map revealed the location of not only the Elder Dragon Mordremoth, but the lost asuran city of <a href="/wiki/Rata_Novus" title="Rata Novus">Rata Novus</a>.
</p>
<dl><dt>Act III</dt></dl>
<p>Upon learning that the Rata Novans had allied with the Exalted before in studying the Elder Dragons, the Commander led Taimi, Braham, and Canach into a detour of the city while the rest of the group continued tracking the surviving members of Destiny's Edge through the jungle. The Commander's party found Rata Novus abandoned, wiped out by the insectoid <a href="/wiki/Chak" title="Chak">chak</a>, but Taimi was able to devise how to power the city back up to access their research. Just outside the city's "dragon lab", however, the party had become trapped, and Taimi decided to use Scruffy to reconnect a ley energy conductor, which overloaded Scruffy, destroying the golem. Unable to continue the journey into the jungle without mobility, Taimi decided it was best to remain behind in Rata Novus to look over the city's research and facilities while the rest of the party left to confront Mordremoth.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Living_World_Season_3"><a href="/wiki/Living_World_Season_3" title="Living World Season 3">Living World Season 3</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=6" title="Edit section: Living World Season 3">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Out_of_the_Shadows" title="Out of the Shadows">Out of the Shadows</a></dt></dl>
<p>In the aftermath of Mordremoth's death, Taimi learned of the deaths of Faolain and Trahearne as well as the injuries which Destiny's Edge members <a href="/wiki/Logan_Thackeray" title="Logan Thackeray">Logan Thackeray</a> and Zojja had suffered in Mordrem captivity. By 1329 <small>AE</small>, she revealed the discovery of Rata Novus to her asuran peers. Although many asura followed to rebuild and study the lost city, Taimi kept the concealed dragon research laboratory as her own secret.<sup id="cite_ref-5" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-5">[5]</a></sup> She began several experiments based on the Elder Dragons, expanding Auric Basin's ley-energy map range across Tyria, and tried filtering different forms of magic through a preserved chak organ which she nicknamed Spencer. With the assistance of <a href="/wiki/Moto" title="Moto">Moto</a>, Taimi was able to boot up a virtual reality simulator below Rata Novus where users could practise fighting dragon minions.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Rising_Flames" title="Rising Flames">Rising Flames</a></dt></dl>
<p>Through her readings on ley-energy, Taimi was forced to tell the Pact Commander of foreboding newsthe Elder Dragon <a href="/wiki/Primordus" title="Primordus">Primordus</a> had become active and traveled from the <a href="/wiki/Shiverpeak_Mountains" title="Shiverpeak Mountains">Shiverpeak Mountains</a> to the southwest towards the <a href="/wiki/Ring_of_Fire" title="Ring of Fire">Ring of Fire</a> in search of magic released from Mordremoth's death. In response Taimi intentionally leaked the news amongst the <a href="/wiki/Arcane_Council" title="Arcane Council">Arcane Council</a>, prompting them to send asuran resources to <a href="/wiki/Ember_Bay" title="Ember Bay">Ember Bay</a>. She also handpicked a few trusted asuran associates to form the <a href="/wiki/New_Novus_Krewe" title="New Novus Krewe">New Novus Krewe</a> which would assist her in studying the Elder Dragons discreetly from more self-serving <a href="/wiki/Krewe" title="Krewe">krewes</a>. During this time Braham sent word to his friends that another Elder Dragon, <a href="/wiki/Jormag" title="Jormag">Jormag</a>, had become active as well.
</p><p>After leaving dragon lab, Taimi and the Commander witnessed Rytlock being taken in by the <a href="/wiki/Adamant_Guard" title="Adamant Guard">Adamant Guard</a> who had been ordered to escort him to the <a href="/wiki/Black_Citadel" title="Black Citadel">Black Citadel</a> for questioning about his time in <a href="/wiki/The_Mists" title="The Mists">the Mists</a>. After Rytlock's departure, Taimi and the Commander saw a scared asuran krewe member <a href="/wiki/Windall" title="Windall">Windall</a> arriving from Ember Bay and revealing that the <a href="/wiki/Destroyer" title="Destroyer">destroyers</a> now inhabiting the island had changed and gained new, deadly powers. Thinking on Windall's story and her experiments on the chak organ Spencer, Taimi realized that the surviving Elder Dragons may have begun absorbing the magic spectrum of the fallen Elder Dragons Mordremoth and <a href="/wiki/Zhaitan" title="Zhaitan">Zhaitan</a> and gained their abilities. To test this theory, Taimi sent the Commander to Ember Bay to gather samples from the changed Destroyers.
</p><p>Taimi later learned that a young dragon named <a href="/wiki/Aurene" title="Aurene">Aurene</a> had hatched from Glint's egg in Tarir and that the Commander had defended the hatchling from a Destroyer attack with the aid of not only the Exalted but also <a href="/wiki/Lazarus" title="Lazarus">Lazarus</a>, the last of the <a href="/wiki/Mursaat" title="Mursaat">mursaat</a>, who had wished to forge an alliance with the Commander in the fight against the Elder Dragons.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/A_Crack_in_the_Ice" title="A Crack in the Ice">A Crack in the Ice</a></dt></dl>
<p>After researching the destroyer samples which the Commander had brought her, Taimi came to the conclusion that her theory of Elder Dragons absorbing the fallen Elder Dragons' influences was correct and learned that the Rata Novan research on Primordus suggested that its magic could be countered by other magic. After a brief talk with the Commander, the prodigy realized that the magic of Jormag, an ice dragon, could potentially counteract the fire magic of Primordus and vice versa. To test her newest theory, she suggested the Commander travel to the far reaches of the <a href="/wiki/Shiverpeak_Mountains" title="Shiverpeak Mountains">Shiverpeak Mountains</a> to gather samples from any potentially altered <a href="/wiki/Icebrood" title="Icebrood">icebrood</a> roaming there.
</p><p>Deep within the <a href="/wiki/Bitterfrost_Frontier" title="Bitterfrost Frontier">Bitterfrost Frontier</a>, did indeed encounter the Svanir and a strong Icebrood presence, however most of these did not exhibit any traits inherited from the slain Elder Dragons. Taimi <a href="/wiki/Elixir_Cookin%27" title="Elixir Cookin'">chimes in</a> with a hypothesis that Jormag's relative distance from Mordremoth and Zhaitan meant that it absorbed far less of the excess magic than Primordus. Despite this, the Commander did indeed encounter an <a href="/wiki/Champion_Unstable_Abomination" title="Champion Unstable Abomination">Icebrood Abomination</a> with Plant and Death magic deep in the bitter cold regions of the Frontier. The sample was eventually sent to Taimi's lab in Rata Novus.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/The_Head_of_the_Snake" title="The Head of the Snake">The Head of the Snake</a></dt></dl>
<p>Overworked and sleep-deprived, Taimi continued her experiments on the gathered samples from tainted Primordus and Jormag minions. In the meantime, the prodigy would also help the Commander track down a trio of strange devices hidden around the <a href="/wiki/Central_Plaza" title="Central Plaza">Central Plaza</a> of Divinity's Reach by applying some remote modifications to the Commander's communicator.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Flashpoint" title="Flashpoint">Flashpoint</a></dt></dl>
<p>The prodigy reached a major breakthrough shortly after, as her experiments successfully proved that both Jormag and Primodus's weakness was each other's magical energy. Taimi then arranged for <a href="/wiki/Omadd%27s_Machine" title="Omadd's Machine">Omadd's Machine</a> to be transported from <a href="/wiki/The_Silverwastes" title="The Silverwastes">the Silverwastes</a> to her lab, planning to delve into configure the machine to be able to channel one Elder Dragon's energy into another, thereby destroying both in the process.
</p><p>It would be several months later before the machine would be ready. In the mean time, the prodigy hid Omadd's Machine in plain sight of <a href="/wiki/Councillor_Phlunt" class="mw-redirect" title="Councillor Phlunt">Councillor Phlunt</a> by convincing her mentor that it was a "coolerator" designed to "revolutionize elixir-cooling." When the machine was finally ready, Taimi invites the Commander, Kasmeer, and Marjory to Rata Novus to unveil it.
</p><p>Unsurprisingly, the Commander and Kasmeer arrive at the ancient asuran lab just as it descends into havoc as the researchers' captured dragon minions break free from their containment. After a quick work subduing the creatures, the party gathered to discuss Taimi's recent discoveries, and their next course of action. Before anything else, in order to maintain Taimi's charade, and her research getting "Phlunted" again, the Commander helps Taimi convince Phlunt to leave the lab with his retinue.
</p><p>However, just as Phlunt's party is about to leave through the asura gate, Marjory runs in. Out of breath, the private investigator quickly relayed her findings while tailing the reborn mursaat, Lazarus. One key revelation was a peculiar mirror Lazarus kept close by his side. Positing that the artifact was part of some form illusion spell, Kasmeer devised a plan to dispel it using some mirrors around the lab. The party was barely ready before a commotion came from the direction of the asura gate, followed by Phlunt and his researchers streaming down the stairs. The gate was malfunctioning, and not allowing egress from the lab.
</p><p>Expecting an inevitable confrontation with Lazarus, but unwilling to risk the lives of her fellow researchers, as much as she despises them, Taimi relents to finally revealing her secret dragon laboratory to Phlunt. While protesting in indignity at first, Phlunt quickly reconsidered his options as Lazarus' viperous voice silenced the room.
</p><p>Somehow aware of Taimi's real work with Omadd's Machine, Lazarus had entered Rata Novus along with a sizeable retinue of mercenaries. Sensing an opening, the Commander remained coy, luring the mursaat to the center of the room, right before Kasmeer activated her spell. Despite his initial resistance, Lazarus' illusion was eventually broken, shattering his Mirror of Lyssa to reveal his true form: <a href="/wiki/Balthazar" title="Balthazar">Balthazar</a>, The God of War and Fire.
</p><p>While the Commander's party reels in disbelief, the god absconds with Omadd's Machine, but not before critically wounding Marjory. Lab on fire, Marjory unconscious, Kasmeer frozen in confusion, and our dear prodigy without a golem, the Commander's attention returned to another realization: there was still a veritable army of mercenaries streaming in from the asura gate.
</p><p>Call it luck, fate, or preservation of ones research, Phlunt took the departure of the God of War as his cue, sending his krewe out to help drive back the invaders. After some effort, Rata Novus was once again secured, if singed. After regrouping, the Commander, with reinforcements from the Pact, rushes of to Draconis Mons, while Taimi stays behind to explore a hunch.
</p><p>The progeny's hunch proves to be true, of course, although it dire news.
</p><p>Based on her simulation, Taimi came to the conclusion that the magical fallout that would result from the death of Jormag and Primordus would severely threaten the entire world. Faced with an impossible choice, Taimi and the Commander decided address the immediate problem of Balthazar, who had already entered the heart of the volcano in the center of Draconis Mons, the <a href="/wiki/Titan%27s_Throat" title="Titan's Throat">Titan's Throat</a>.
</p><p>Deep in the inferno, Taimi once again demonstrated her genius by deploying <a href="/wiki/Scruffy_2.0" title="Scruffy 2.0">Scruffy 2.0</a> into the volcano, proving her technology could match the magic of four elder druids. The duo slowly descended deeper into the inferno, breaking past energy barriers set up by Balthazar's goons. Then at the very heart of the volcano, they found Omadd's Machine activated, and already channeling energy to and from the Elder Dragon Primordus. With scant time to spare, Taimi -- with the help of the Commander fending off Balthazar's Hounds, <a href="/wiki/Tegon" title="Tegon">Tegon</a> and <a href="/wiki/Temar" title="Temar">Temar</a> -- disabled their one and only means of destroying both Elder Dragons of fire and ice.
</p><p>Luckily, due to the magical assault sustained, both Elder Dragons soon retreated back into dormancy.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/One_Path_Ends" title="One Path Ends">One Path Ends</a></dt></dl>
<div class="metadata section-stub" style="padding-left:25px;margin-bottom:10px"><i>Section-stub. This key section of the article is incomplete. You can help the Guild Wars 2 Wiki by <span class="plainlinks"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//wiki.guildwars2.com/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit">expanding it</a></span>. </i><br> <b>Reason:</b>  Add missing information. </div>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Path_of_Fire"><a href="/wiki/Guild_Wars_2:_Path_of_Fire" title="Guild Wars 2: Path of Fire">Path of Fire</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=7" title="Edit section: Path of Fire">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<p>While the Pact Commander traveled to the <a href="/wiki/Crystal_Desert" title="Crystal Desert">Crystal Desert</a> in 1330 <small>AE</small> to stop the rogue <a href="/wiki/Six_Human_Gods" title="Six Human Gods">god</a> <a href="/wiki/Balthazar" title="Balthazar">Balthazar</a> from killing the Elder Dragon <a href="/wiki/Kralkatorrik" title="Kralkatorrik">Kralkatorrik</a> and destroying <a href="/wiki/Tyria_(world)" title="Tyria (world)">Tyria</a> in the process, Taimi remained in Tarir to watch over Aurene. However, Aurene began acting more and more aggressively over time, and Caithe and the <a href="/wiki/Luminate" title="Luminate">Luminate</a> discussed the issue with Taimi who stayed in contact with the Commander via a remote communication device.
</p><p>They learned that Aurene was reacting to sensing her brother <a href="/wiki/Vlast" title="Vlast">Vlast</a>'s death at the hands of Balthazar, and the trio did their best to try to calm the hatchling down. When Aurene sensed that Balthazar was about to kill the Commander, however, she escaped from Tarir and flew to the Crystal Desert while her caretakers could do nothing but watch helplessly as she departed.<sup id="cite_ref-contactpoints_6-0" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-contactpoints-6">[6]</a></sup> Taimi tried to contact the Commander with important information during the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Kodash_Bazaar" title="Battle of Kodash Bazaar">Battle of Kodash Bazaar</a> but the distortion caused by the magic unleashed in the clash between Balthazar and Kralkatorrik cut off her signal before the Commander could hear what she had to say.
</p><p>When Phlunt had all but taken over Taimi's former lab in Rata Novus, Taimi decided to leave. She and Scruffy 2.0 flew to the <a href="/wiki/Free_City_of_Amnoon" title="Free City of Amnoon">Free City of Amnoon</a> aboard <a href="/wiki/Ellen_Kiel" class="mw-redirect" title="Ellen Kiel">Ellen Kiel</a>'s airship with representatives from Lion's Arch just in time to witness the Commander returning from vanquishing Balthazar. Taimi explained her reasons for traveling to Amnoon before learning that Kralkatorrik had absorbed most of Balthazar's energy. However, the conversation was cut short by <a href="/wiki/Chief_Councilor_Imann" title="Chief Councilor Imann">Chief Councilor Imann</a> who requested the Commander's presence to the party as the hero.
</p><p>While the Commander delivered a speech to the eager festival audience, Rytlock filled Taimi in on what had happened in the desert. The sudden arrival of the recovered Marjory lifted the spirits of Dragon's Watch although their joy was cut short when a <a href="/wiki/Brandstorm" class="mw-redirect" title="Brandstorm">Brandstorm</a> summoned by Kralkatorrik suddenly hit Amnoon. The storm was over shortly after, however, and Taimi decided to use the calm before the next storm to make one last call to her dragon lab. She pranked Phlunt by sounding like an angered <a href="/wiki/Iron_Legion" title="Iron Legion">Iron Legion</a> charr before ending the call, feeling less sour about losing much of her research equipment to Phlunt's krewe.<sup id="cite_ref-contactpoints_6-1" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-contactpoints-6">[6]</a></sup>
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="Living_World_Season_4"><a href="/wiki/Living_World_Season_4" title="Living World Season 4">Living World Season 4</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=8" title="Edit section: Living World Season 4">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Daybreak" title="Daybreak">Daybreak</a></dt></dl>
<p>After the defeat of Balthazar, Taimi and Rytlock rendezvoused with the Commander in the <a href="/wiki/Amnoon_Southern_Outskirts" title="Amnoon Southern Outskirts">Amnoon Southern Outskirts</a> to discuss how to proceed with Kralkatorrik. Their discussion ended abruptly as another Brandstorm formed over Amnoon, prompting the Commander and Rytlock to save the city from the empowered <a href="/wiki/Branded" title="Branded">Branded</a> while Taimi stayed behind to run some analysis. As a <a href="/wiki/Branded_Griffon" title="Branded Griffon">Branded Griffon</a> was about to attack the Commander during the battle, Taimi appeared and blasted the griffon using <a href="/wiki/Scruffy_2.0" title="Scruffy 2.0">Scruffy 2.0</a>'s newly installed offensive capabilities. The group members, who were joined by <a href="/wiki/Shadows_Agent_Kito" title="Shadows Agent Kito">Shadows Agent Kito</a> and <a href="/wiki/Canach" title="Canach">Canach</a>, witnessed a shared vision from a grown <a href="/wiki/Aurene" title="Aurene">Aurene</a> that made them aware of the approaching threat of the <a href="/wiki/Awakened" title="Awakened">Awakened</a> and pointed them in the direction of <a href="/wiki/Fahranur,_the_First_City" title="Fahranur, the First City">Fahranur, the First City</a>. The Commander then made their way over to the <a href="/wiki/Domain_of_Istan" title="Domain of Istan">Domain of Istan</a> to investigate the matter.
</p><p>While the Commander was in Istan, <a href="/wiki/Palawa_Joko" title="Palawa Joko">Palawa Joko</a> found and kidnapped Taimi in order to enter an Inquest lab set up in Fahranur so that he could launch his attacks on Tyria using <a href="/wiki/Asura_gate" title="Asura gate">asura gates</a>. Although Taimi was reluctant to share information with him at first, Joko threatened her life and forced her to follow his commands. After learning that Taimi was in danger from an abruptly cut transmission, the Commander rushed to Fahranur along with Canach, Rytlock, and <a href="/wiki/Spearmarshal_Zaeim" title="Spearmarshal Zaeim">Spearmarshal Zaeim</a> to rescue her. They were later joined by Rox and Braham, who got there via an asura gate that the Awakened had been using to enter Tyria. By the time they reached Taimi, they realized that Joko had overridden Scruffy 2.0's controls to trap Taimi inside of the golem and initiated an oxygen purge in order to suffocate her. Having no choice, the Commander destroyed Scruffy 2.0 to break Taimi out. Although Taimi was saved, the near death experience left its mark on her, and she stopped using her hair bow.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/A_Bug_in_the_System" title="A Bug in the System">A Bug in the System</a></dt></dl>
<p>In the time since the Fahranur lab attack, Taimi found the name of an Inquest scientist, Blish, and explained that he was her friend from college. While the Commander infiltrated <a href="/wiki/Lab_Sigma-05" title="Lab Sigma-05">Lab Sigma-05</a> in 1331 <small>AE</small>, Taimi learned that Gorrik, Blish's younger brother, had joined the Inquest as well. She expressed worry about the brothers' safety when Dragon's Watch found out that the Awakened had invaded the Inquest complex where the pair had been working in. As Dragon's Watch assaulted <a href="/wiki/Rata_Primus" title="Rata Primus">Rata Primus</a>, the Inquest's base of operations in <a href="/wiki/Sandswept_Isles" title="Sandswept Isles">Sandswept Isles</a>, Taimi stayed behind on <a href="/wiki/Sayida_the_Sly" title="Sayida the Sly">Sayida the Sly</a>'s airship and waited for the brothers to be escorted out.
</p><p>When Taimi saw that Blish had become a golem, she was intrigued by the idea, saying he was "free of life's frailties", while most had reacted with horror or revulsion. After learning that Blish had saved data related to Inquest studies on the <a href="/wiki/Scarab_Plague" title="Scarab Plague">Scarab Plague</a> and Kralkatorrik, Taimi recruited the brothers to her krewe. The three of them began working together to study the notes Blish had been able to save on his hard drive.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Long_Live_the_Lich" title="Long Live the Lich">Long Live the Lich</a></dt></dl>
<p>After traveling to the <a href="/wiki/Free_City_of_Amnoon" title="Free City of Amnoon">Free City of Amnoon</a>, Blish and Gorrik began researching the Scarab Plague. Gorrik discovered that the scarabs only infected humans and planted <a href="/wiki/Petey" title="Petey">Petey</a>, another species of beetle, under his skin to test another theory of his, but locals discovered what he was up to and arrested him after mistaking him for planning to unleash some pestilence in the city. Taimi then called the Commander for help.
</p><p>After the Commander and Taimi had helped clear the charges against Gorrik, the trio went to the docks and eventually found Blish. Upon being rebooted, Blish returned to consciousness with a horrified scream, letting his companions know of his lack of sensory experiences in what he described as nothingness while he had been shut down. Taimi and Gorrik hastily promised never to let him experience that kind of state again and monitored him while the Commander left them to meet with <a href="/wiki/Lord_Faren" title="Lord Faren">Lord Faren</a> and <a href="/wiki/Councilor_Mayameen" title="Councilor Mayameen">Councilor Mayameen</a> who were waiting for a Tyrian supply ship to arrive at the docks.
</p><p>Blish, Gorrik and Taimi went to the docks later and learned that the Commander had barely prevented an outbreak of the first generation of <a href="/wiki/Scarab_Plague" title="Scarab Plague">Scarab Plague</a> carried by the crew of the supply ship whom Joko had secretly infected. Taimi then suggested the Commander pay a visit to the <a href="/wiki/Primeval_Dynasty" title="Primeval Dynasty">Primeval Dynasty</a> due to their experiences of the Scarab Plague.
</p><p>While the Commander was on the mission to scout and clear out a place for their main camp, Taimi, Blish and Gorrik stayed in touch and gave various advice. After the area was ready for troops to come, Taimi, Gorrik and Blish used the portal and arrived at the <a href="/wiki/Domain_of_Kourna" title="Domain of Kourna">Domain of Kourna</a>.
</p><p>Taimi stayed inside the main camp until the <a href="/wiki/Be_My_Guest" title="Be My Guest">Battle of Gandara</a>. She and the others followed the Commander to the front gate of the <a href="/wiki/Gandara,_the_Moon_Fortress" title="Gandara, the Moon Fortress">Moon Fortress</a>, but was stopped by the third generation of scarabs, and had fall back to Rytlock's position while the Primeval Queens <a href="/wiki/Queen_Nahlah" title="Queen Nahlah">Nahlah</a> and <a href="/wiki/Queen_Dahlah" title="Queen Dahlah">Dahlah</a> cleaning the scarabs while the commander chasing after Braham.
</p><p>Gorrik and Taimi went inside the fortress after the third-generation epidemic was averted and learned that Joko was dead. Gorrik then surprisingly found lots of pestilence samples to study, but Taimi decided everything about the plague will be destroy after Gorrik collect the data.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/A_Star_to_Guide_Us" title="A Star to Guide Us">A Star to Guide Us</a></dt></dl>
<p>After the death of Palawa Joko in the <a href="/wiki/Battle_of_Gandara" title="Battle of Gandara">Battle of Gandara</a>, Taimi was present during the meeting between the remaining Elonian leaders at a summit held in the <a href="/wiki/Fortress_of_Jahai" title="Fortress of Jahai">Fortress of Jahai</a>. While the Commander attended the summit, Taimi took Aurene outside, then escorted her from the fortress during the attack by the <a href="/wiki/Death-Branded_Shatterer" title="Death-Branded Shatterer">Death-Branded Shatterer</a>. Once the Shatterer's assault had ended, Taimi asked the Commander to recover data from various areas affected by the weakening of the barrier between Tyria and the Mists and came to a chilling conclusion: the rifts were being caused by Kralkatorrik testing its new abilities with the power it had consumed from Balthazar. She eventually realized that Kralkatorrik was actively hunting for Aurene and that it was using Aurene's presence as a physical anchor through which to invade Tyrian locations from the Mists.
</p><p>When Blish sacrificed himself to power the tracker in Balthazar's greatsword during the excursion into the Mists, he told the Commander that their group needed to stop keeping secrets. Upon learning of Blish's fate and his last words from the Commander, Taimi revealed that her degenerative disease was no longer in remission and that the pain had gotten worse, and she was not sure how much time she had left.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/All_or_Nothing" title="All or Nothing">All or Nothing</a></dt></dl>
<p>In <a href="/wiki/Thunderhead_Peaks" title="Thunderhead Peaks">Thunderhead Peaks</a>, Gorrik and Taimi used the tracker Blish made to evacuate several villages before Kralkatorriks minions broke through. As the plan for the final battle was made, Taimi came up with the plan to amplify the crystal with dredge technology to hurt Kralkatorrik. When the final battle initiated, Taimi and Gorrik stayed high above the fight and gave the Commander information from above. After Kralkatorrik got away and Aurene was killed, Taimi and Gorrik found her branded body. When the Commander got there, they were grieving for her.
</p><p>When the Commander returned to Thunderhead Peaks to <a href="/wiki/The_End" title="The End">prepare Aurenes body</a>, Gorrik and Taimi was there waiting.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/War_Eternal" title="War Eternal">War Eternal</a></dt></dl>
<p>At <a href="/wiki/Dragonfall" title="Dragonfall">Dragonfall</a>, Taimi called a helicopter to collect Dragonsblood and analyzed the data which came from Gorriks instruments with Gorrik. The data shown that Kralkatorrik was healing throught ley line energy on the island. To cut down Kralkatorrik from ley line, Gorrik and Taimi helped the Commander made the new <a href="/wiki/Dragonsblood_Spear_(Bleed_skill)" title="Dragonsblood Spear (Bleed skill)">Dragonsblood Spear</a>.
</p><p>After Aurene had <a href="/wiki/Descent" title="Descent">ascended</a>, Taimi was with the others on Sayida's airship and having drinks. She said she wanted to write a "six-volume treatise", and asked the Commander if they would meet Aurene again as she wanted to interview her.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="The_Icebrood_Saga"><a href="/wiki/The_Icebrood_Saga" title="The Icebrood Saga">The Icebrood Saga</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=9" title="Edit section: The Icebrood Saga">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Prologue:_Bound_by_Blood" title="Prologue: Bound by Blood">Prologue: Bound by Blood</a></dt></dl>
<p>Some time after Kralkatorrik's demise, the Commander and members of Dragon's Watch were invited to participate the victory in the <a href="/wiki/All-Legion_Rally" title="All-Legion Rally">All-Legion Rally</a> organized by <a href="/wiki/Blood_Legion" title="Blood Legion">Blood Legion</a> <a href="/wiki/Imperator" title="Imperator">Imperator</a> <a href="/wiki/Bangar_Ruinbringer" title="Bangar Ruinbringer">Bangar Ruinbringer</a> in <a href="/wiki/Grothmar_Valley" title="Grothmar Valley">Grothmar Valley</a>. Taimi chose not to attend the festivities as she focused on working on her treatise, titled "The Elder Dragons Reconsidered." However, she insisted that Gorrik should accompany the Commander's party to Grothmar so he could "live a little." Gorrik reluctantly did what Taimi had asked but only for a chance to study the local fauna.<sup id="cite_ref-7" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-7">[7]</a></sup>
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Champions" title="Champions">Champions</a> <a href="/wiki/Chapter_1:_Truce" title="Chapter 1: Truce">Chapter 1: Truce</a></dt></dl>
<p>Following Jormag's <a href="/wiki/One_Charr,_One_Dragon,_One_Champion" title="One Charr, One Dragon, One Champion">awakening</a> thanks to Bangar and his lieutenant <a href="/wiki/Ryland_Steelcatcher" title="Ryland Steelcatcher">Ryland Steelcatcher</a>'s actions in 1333 <small>AE</small>, the Commander sent word to Taimi to have her monitor Mist rifts and ley lines in order to keep an eye on Elder Dragon's activities. Although Taimi had been unable to locate the elusive Ice Dragon with her devices in the <a href="/wiki/Advanced_Metamystics_Lab" title="Advanced Metamystics Lab">Advanced Metamystics Lab</a>, she had picked up a series of quakes that were growing in number and intensity and asked the Commander to visit her in Rata Sum so they could discuss her findings. Ryland, Rytlock's son who had become Jormag's main champion after the Ice Dragon's awakening, had also traveled to Rata Sum to form an alliance with the Arcane Council as the asura and Jormag faced a common enemy in Primordus. Both Jormag and the council believed that the Fire Dragon's awakening was imminent and would be heralded by the coming of destroyers.
</p><p>While showing the Commander the latest locations with quakes, Taimi suddenly registered the largest movement under Rata Sum itself. Before the party could discuss the data in depth, powerful destroyers emerged just outside the lab. The Commander, Rytlock and Ryland dispatched the first wave only to receive Braham's distress call from down at the docks. Taimi reconfigured the gate to take the party directly there. Ryland helped turn the tide at the docks by summong his fellow <a href="/wiki/Dragon_energy" title="Dragon energy">corrupted</a> charr soldiers, the <a href="/wiki/Frost_Legion" title="Frost Legion">Frost Legion</a>, to assist in the battle against the destroyers while protecting the Arcane Council.
</p><p>After the carnage, Gorrik, Taimi, and the Council set out to study the newly evolved destroyers in the hopes that they could track their subterranean movements. Ryland offered to station some of his Frost Legion in the city for protection, though his offer was politely declined. As Jormag's champion, he promised that Jormag would restore the asura's ancient homelands in the <a href="/wiki/Depths_of_Tyria" title="Depths of Tyria">Depths of Tyria</a> to them as a token of goodwill once the asura had helped the icebrood slay Primordus.
</p><p>Taimi continued monitoring quake activity and <a href="/wiki/Defending_Tyria" title="Defending Tyria">discovered</a> a strong signal near <a href="/wiki/Soren_Draa" title="Soren Draa">Soren Draa</a> which came under attack by destroyers. With her urging, the Commander and Braham traveled to the settlement to help with the evacuation, and Taimi soon arrived in her restored Scruffy 2.0 to continue <a href="/wiki/Dragon_Response_Mission:_Metrica_Province" title="Dragon Response Mission: Metrica Province">investigating</a> the source of the signal. As the party headed deeper into the <a href="/wiki/Wildflame_Caverns" title="Wildflame Caverns">Wildflame Caverns</a>, Taimi revealed that Jormag had granted the asura information which might help figuring out Primordus's weakness. One of these discoveries was the fact that Jormag and Primordus were in fact twins and their powers were evenly matched.
</p><p>While tracking the energy source, Braham and Taimi began arguing about the asura's alliance with Jormag. While Braham pointed out that Jormag had caused centuries of hardship for the norn the <a href="/wiki/Spirits_of_the_Wild" title="Spirits of the Wild">Spirits of the Wild</a> and could not be trusted, Taimi countered by stating that Jormag could at least be reasoned with unlike the destructive Primordus, and that the asura had had to abandon the Depths of Tyria entirely during Primordus's rampage while the norn could still live in the Southern Shiverpeaks after Jormag's initial push south. Taimi tried to support her argument by stating that they already had a good relationship with one Elder Dragon, Aurene, and that former enemies could become friends as had happened with Logan and Rytlock. Both Braham and the Commander remained skeptical regarding Jormag's trustworthiness, however.
</p><p>Before the arguing could continue, the party finally located the energy signature which belonged to a powerful champion known as the <a href="/wiki/Destroyer_of_the_Ironhammer_Line" title="Destroyer of the Ironhammer Line">Destroyer of the Ironhammer Line</a>. After a fierce battle, they managed to defeat the champion while Braham revealed that he now could sense destroyers somehow. The feeling of elation was short lived, however, as tensions between Braham and Taimi boiled over again. They both admitted their fears of the Elder Dragon threat that jeopardized their homes, their people, and their interests were at odds as the asura wanted Primordus dead while the norn wanted to vanquish Jormag. Taimi did, however, acknowledge that they could focus on Jormag should the Ice Dragon become a threat but only after the more immediate threat, Primordus, had been dealt with.
</p>
<dl><dt>Champions <a href="/wiki/Chapter_2:_Power" title="Chapter 2: Power">Chapter 2: Power</a></dt></dl>
<p>With the mission a success and discovering a curious link between the destroyers and Primordus during the battle with the champion, Taimi returned to monitor the quakes and energy spikes. She was present in the Arcane Council chambers when Ryland <a href="/wiki/Jormag%27s_World" title="Jormag's World">arrived</a> to inquire about the asura's progress with finding the Fire Dragon's weakness. Taimi and Gorrik had collaborated with the Council and discovered that the feedback loop of magic between Primordus and the destroyers was creating a vicious cycle empowering them both, all started with Kralkatorrik's death and the subsequent absorption of the Crystal Dragon's magic. The balance of power was beginning to favor Primordus thanks to the empowered destroyers' activity, so the alliance needed to find a way to either starve the Fire Dragon or redirect its magic to Jormag.
</p><p>Intrigued by the asura's findings, Ryland departed in order to test their theory and discover a way to further empower Jormag for the inevitable clash with Primordus once the Fire Dragon was ready to rise. Taimi informed the Commander that the energy signatures suggested Lake Doric to be the destroyers' next target, and the Commander traveled there to assist with the evacuation there.
</p>
<dl><dt>Champions <a href="/wiki/Chapter_3:_Balance" title="Chapter 3: Balance">Chapter 3: Balance</a></dt></dl>
<div class="metadata section-stub" style="padding-left:25px;margin-bottom:10px"><i>Section-stub. This key section of the article is incomplete. You can help the Guild Wars 2 Wiki by <span class="plainlinks"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//wiki.guildwars2.com/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit">expanding it</a></span>. </i><br> <b>Reason:</b>  Add missing information. </div>
<p>Like her allies, Taimi is appalled when Jormag's cruel act of freezing innocent people to bolster their forces is revealed. Taimi pointed out that due to this act, the balance of powers was shifting in favor of Jormag. To prevent further complications in the quest to defeat both Primordus and Jormag, the <a href="/wiki/Pact_Commander" title="Pact Commander">pact commander</a> requests Taimi to talk to the Arcane Council to stop their meddling in the balance of powers.
</p><p>After the pact commander defeats the icebrood and frost legion attack at Caledon Forest, Taimi radios the pact commander of a sudden massive spike in Primordus's activities and is concerned on it's implications.
</p>
<dl><dt>Champions <a href="/wiki/Chapter_4:_Judgment" title="Chapter 4: Judgment">Chapter 4: Judgment</a></dt></dl>
<div class="metadata section-stub" style="padding-left:25px;margin-bottom:10px"><i>Section-stub. This key section of the article is incomplete. You can help the Guild Wars 2 Wiki by <span class="plainlinks"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//wiki.guildwars2.com/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit">expanding it</a></span>. </i><br> <b>Reason:</b>  Add missing information. </div>
<p>Thanks to Braham's heroic sacrifice to become Primordus's champion which helped even the scales of the balance of powers, a rare moment of opportunity has presented itself to defeat both Primordus and Jormag. Taimi explains that both dragons are connected to the ley lines' power and luring both dragons to clash in a place of ley line confluence would result in a massive magical fallout that may bring an end to both dragons once and for all. For her plan to work, Taimi theorizes that Aurene's prismatic powers would be crucial to cut both dragons' connection to the ley lines. In the ensuing battle against the dragons and their champions, Taimi is exuberated when her plan comes to fruition.
</p>
<dl><dt><a href="/wiki/Current_Events" title="Current Events">Research in the Eye of the North</a></dt></dl>
<p>After witnessing the clash between the two Elder Dragons, Taimi and Gorrik returned to the Eye of the North, setting up a laboratory near Aurene so they could study and investigate the dragon cycle and any changes to the world from the magical fallout.<sup id="cite_ref-8" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-8">[8]</a></sup> As there were no visible consequences from the deaths of the dragons yet, Taimi suggested that either Aurene was able to contain the excess magic alone, something else got its share of magic, or that the world is simply short on time.<sup id="cite_ref-9" class="reference"><a href="#cite_note-9">[9]</a></sup> To help with the research, Gorrik proposed to the Commander that they could use the Scrying Pool to search the Commander's memories of their past battles and struggles against the Elder Dragons. Although the Commander initially protested, in the end they accepted and went to relive their memories, starting with <a href="/wiki/Living_World_Season_2#Gates_of_Maguuma" title="Living World Season 2">following the disturbance</a> in <a href="/wiki/Brisban_Wildlands" title="Brisban Wildlands">Brisban Wildlands</a> while Gorrik and Taimi went onto studying and recollecting provided data.
</p>
<h3><span class="mw-headline" id="End_of_Dragons"><a href="/wiki/End_of_Dragons" class="mw-redirect" title="End of Dragons">End of Dragons</a></span><span class="mw-editsection"><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">[</span><a href="/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit&section=10" title="Edit section: End of Dragons">edit</a><span class="mw-editsection-bracket">]</span></span></h3>
<div class="metadata section-stub" style="padding-left:25px;margin-bottom:10px"><i>Section-stub. This key section of the article is incomplete. You can help the Guild Wars 2 Wiki by <span class="plainlinks"><a rel="nofollow" class="external text" href="//wiki.guildwars2.com/index.php?title=Taimi&action=edit">expanding it</a></span>. </i> </div>
<p>Taimi followed the Commander to <a href="/wiki/Cantha" title="Cantha">Cantha</a> with the rest of the diplomatic group sent by <a href="/wiki/Queen_Jennah" title="Queen Jennah">Queen Jennah</a> after the Commander and <a href="/wiki/Gorrik" title="Gorrik">Gorrik</a>'s crash-landing. Once there, she met and quickly began working with <a href="/wiki/Joon" title="Joon">Joon</a>, the founder of Jade technology. Throughout much of the company's stay in <a href="/wiki/Cantha" title="Cantha">Cantha</a>, Taimi would be found at <a href="/wiki/Joon" title="Joon">Joon</a>'s side.
</p>
<dl><dt>Epilogue</dt></dl>
<p>Afterward, at <a href="/wiki/Marjory" class="mw-redirect" title="Marjory">Marjory</a> and <a href="/wiki/Kasmeer" class="mw-redirect" title="Kasmeer">Kasmeer</a>'s party, Taimi told the Commander that she has been working with <a href="/wiki/Joon" title="Joon">Joon</a> trying to solve <a href="/wiki/Cantha" title="Cantha">Cantha</a>'s imminent power crisis.
</p>
